intro: Neurotheca longidens, commonly known as the long-stalked neurotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its robust, erect stems and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elongated, fibrous fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
